title.value: Protocol to perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data using an interpretable deep learning technique
title.justification: The title clearly outlines the main focus of the paper, which is on a protocol for integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data using a deep learning technique.
title.quote: Protocol to perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data using an interpretable deep learning technique

extractions.description: The paper presents a protocol for integrating multiple modalities in single-cell multi-omics data using an interpretable deep learning technique called moETM. It explains steps for data preprocessing, multi-omics integration, cross-omics imputation, and incorporation of prior pathway knowledge. The protocol is demonstrated using single-cell multi-omics data from bone marrow mononuclear cells (GSE194122).

type.justification: The paper involves practical steps for implementing a protocol using data and evaluating outcomes, indicating it is empirical in nature.
type.quote: As a demonstration, we used the single-cell multi-omics data collected from bone marrow mononuclear cells (GSE194122) as in our original study.

name.justification: The research focuses on techniques for integrating data from various single-cell modalities like transcriptomes, proteins, and chromatin accessibility.
name.quote: The advent of single-cell multi-omics sequencing technology makes it possible for researchers to leverage multiple modalities for individual cells.

name.justification: The methodology discussed involves integrating multiple omic data modalities into a unified analysis framework.
name.quote: Steps for integrating multiple modalities to a low-dimensional representation

name.justification: The method used in the paper is a deep learning technique, specifically called moETM, for data integration and analysis.
name.quote: Here, we present a protocol to perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data using an interpretable deep learning technique called moETM.

name.justification: This is the deep learning model proposed and used in the study to perform the integrative analysis of single-cell multimodal data.
name.quote: Here, we present a protocol to perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data using an interpretable deep learning technique called moETM.

is_contributed.justification: moETM is presented as the technique developed in the study for integrating single-cell multi-omics data.
is_contributed.quote: This paper...an interpretable deep learning model called moETM to integrate single-cell multi-omics data.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes the execution of moETM and provides a detailed protocol for its application, including hardware specifications and code repository.
is_executed.quote: The implementation of moETM requires GPU usage.

is_compared.justification: The paper focuses on detailing the implementation and application of moETM rather than comparing its performance with other models.
is_compared.quote: In this protocol, we implemented a unified interpretable deep learning model called moETM to integrate single-cell multi-omics data...

referenced_paper_title.value: Single-cell multi-omics topic embedding reveals cell-type-specific and COVID-19 severity-related immune signatures
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title matches one that involves single-cell multi-omics, aligning with the context where moETM is applied.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Zhou, M., Zhang, H., Bai, Z., Mann-Krzisnik, D., Wang, F., and Li, Y. (2023). Single-cell multi-omics topic embedding reveals cell-type-specific and COVID-19 severity-related immune signatures.

name.justification: The dataset GSE194122 is used as a demonstration in the study for integrating single-cell multi-omics data using the moETM model.
name.quote: As a demonstration, we used the single-cell multi-omics data collected from bone marrow mononuclear cells (GSE194122) as in our original study.

referenced_paper_title.value: A sandbox for prediction and integration of DNA, RNA, and proteins in single cells

referenced_paper_title.quote: Luecken et al. (2021). A sandbox for prediction and integration of DNA, RNA, and proteins in single cells.

name.justification: This dataset is mentioned as an example in the context of how raw data can be preprocessed to be used with the moETM model.
name.quote: The mouse kidney cell sci-CAR data (GSE117089) used in the original study...

referenced_paper_title.value: Joint profiling of chromatin accessibility and gene expression in thousands of single cells
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper referenced describes methodologies relevant to single-cell chromatin accessibility and expression profiling, which aligns with the dataset usage context in the protocol.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Cao et al. (2018). Joint profiling of chromatin accessibility and gene expression in thousands of single cells.

name.justification: GSE140203 is used as an example in the data preprocessing step to integrate shared single-cell profiling information.
name.quote: Mouse skin cell SHARE-seq and Mouse brain cell SHARE-seq (GSE140203).

referenced_paper_title.value: Chromatin Potential Identified by Shared Single-Cell Profiling of RNA and Chromatin

referenced_paper_title.quote: Ma et al. (2020). Chromatin Potential Identified by Shared Single-Cell Profiling of RNA and Chromatin.

name.justification: This dataset is mentioned concerning CITE-seq data related to healthy and COVID-19 patient samples, showing its use in the study.
name.quote: PBMC CITE-seq and COVID-19 PBMC CITE-seq (GSE164378).

referenced_paper_title.value: Integrated analysis of multimodal single-cell data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper aligns with the integration and multimodal nature of the datasets used in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Hao et al. (2021). Integrated analysis of multimodal single-cell data.

name.justification: PyTorch is explicitly mentioned as an installation requirement for running moETM as it provides the deep learning framework needed for the model.
name.quote: Install PyTorch from the website https://pytorch.org/.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: PyTorch is generally referenced in literature for its imperative style and high-performance capabilities in deep learning tasks as utilized in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Install PyTorch from the website https://pytorch.org/.

name.justification: The protocol specifies the use of Scanpy for preprocessing tasks, making it a direct part of the analysis pipeline for single-cell data.
name.quote: For the BMMC1 data, both modalities underwent a 3-step preprocessing procedure: normalize counts per cell by scanpy.pp.normalize_total, logarithmize the data matrix by scanpy.pp.log1p...

referenced_paper_title.value: SCANPY: large-scale single-cell gene expression data analysis
referenced_paper_title.justification: Scanpy's role in large-scale single-cell data analysis aligns with its use in this study's protocol, as referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Scanpy 1.9.1... Wolf et al. (2018). SCANPY: large-scale single-cell gene expression data analysis.

name.justification: AnnData is used to handle data formats that are input to the moETM model, highlighting its usage in the data processing stage.
name.quote: The input data is in the AnnData format and is loaded and preprocessed by the load_*_dataset() and prepare_*_dataset() functions in the dataloader.py script.

referenced_paper_title.justification: AnnData is referenced in studies dealing with annotated datasets, which corresponds with its application in managing single-cell datasets here.
referenced_paper_title.quote: AnnData 0.8.0... Virshup et al. (2021). AnnData: Annotated data.

name.justification: Seurat is indirectly mentioned within the context of relevant companion scripts for data analysis, indicating its usage in the multimodal data context.
